description: Number of non-isomorphic arrangements of n lines in the real projective plane such that the lines do not pass through a common point and no point belongs to more than 2 lines.
references: J. E. Goodman and J. O'Rourke, editors, Handbook of Discrete and Computational Geometry, CRC Press, 1997, p. 102.
B. Gr√ºnbaum, Arrangements and Spreads. American Mathematical Society, Providence, RI, 1972, p. 6.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
extensions: The next term is conjectured to be 135.
